From: "shaflidason" <styrmis@...>
> <shanemcdonaldryan@...> wrote:
> >
> > Has anyone ever compared the performance of grammatical evolution to
> > neuro evolution? Perhaps on the standard problems pole-balancing, xor.
> > 
> > It seems quite promising and I can post my results when they are done.
> > But I wanted to see if anyone else has looked into it before I do.
> > I've invested quite a bit of enery in NE but GE looks very promising,
> > and I like the fact that it produces actual code rather than a black
> > box. Which makes it more appropriate for some domains. ie commercial
> > video games.

I did some comparaisons of NEAT with regards to our attribute grammar
based encoding (this is not grammatical evolution but it's related). I
used a pole-balancing task and a task in which a multi-dof robotic arm
had to move to defined positions. Our system performed a bit better
than NEAT on these tasks but NEAT could probably be tweaked
more. While I'm very happy with the theoritical features of the
encodings (it's hierarchical, modular and formalized), more benchmarks
will be needed to draw any final conclusion about the "efficiency"
(btw, Ken previously highlighted the problems with benchmarks such as
those).

See : http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s12065-008-0015-7

Best regards,
-- 
Jean-Baptiste Mouret / Mandor
